availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Maryland.
Baltimore City to Wit: --
Be it Remembered.

And it is hereby certified that on the twenty seventy day of April Eighteen hundred and sixty four, before me the subscriber, a clerk of the Superior Court of Baltimore City in the State of Maryland, personally appeared Henry Howard Burgess, Commissioner for the State of Kentucky in the State of Maryland, and made oath on the Holy Evangely of Almighty God, that he will well and faithfully discharge all the duties of such commissioner according to the laws of the State of Kentucky. --
In Testimony whereof I hereunto set my hand and affix the Seal of the Superior Court of Baltimore City this Twenty Seventh day of April in the year of Our Lord Eighteen hundred and sixty four.

Alford Mace, clk
of the Superior Court of Baltimore City

figure.ab:
HENRY HOWARD BURGESS
H H B
COMMISSIONER

body.p:

City, State of Maryland --

Alford Mace

Maryland
H. H. Burgess
